hive_text_custom.text: : Hi. Are you an introvert or an extrovert?
: I’m not sure, you know. Sometimes I think that I’m basically an introvert.
: I don’t really like going to parties that much if there’s going to be new people there. If it’s my friends, I’m happy to go out, but I don’t know. What about you?
: It’s funny what you said. I feel the same way. I think sometimes I’m an introvert and other times I can be an extrovert. But maybe
to what you said. I feel like the older
: While I was younger, I was a lot shier, so I preferred my own company. But now I find that sometimes too, I really enjoy people. So I like to meet new ones. So yeah.
: Yes. In the classroom, as a teacher, I’m quite an extrovert I think.
being up in front of students and
, but I would never do that in front of other teachers or my friends, in my personal life.
: But something about the classroom maybe because it’s my environment and I’m in control that I feel more comfortable,
more extroverted and showing off, camping up.

a little difficult to be introverted if you were a language teacher. I think it certainly helps to be extroverted or to act to be able to become more extroverted when you’re in the classroom for sure.
: Yeah. And have you ever done anything really extroverted, like performed
: Before I used to sing actually, and I have sang in concerts.
: And it’s true. I think that’s where my introverted self really comes out because although I enjoy singing, and I like the attention to
, but I get really nervous. Really, really nervous when I’m in front of a large crowd. And sometimes
, “Why am I doing this to myself? Why am I here?”
: But yeah, I don’t do that so much anymore.
: Right. And do you think people can change? Do you think people – because people seem to want to become more extroverted? It seems to be like society says extroverted people are successful people.
: Do you think people can change or do you think people should try to change?

: I’ve heard of actually people saying that depending on the language that people change with the language. I’ve heard of some of my students saying that when they speak in a different language, their personality actually changes, where maybe in their own language, they may be quieter. But when they speak the different language, they become a lot more extroverted.
: It’s as if they change. So whether or not it’s a real change I think you can “fake it”
even if you’re not an extrovert or an introvert. Maybe for a few hours or for the occasion. Yeah, you can pretend, and then go back.
: Right. I wonder if when we speak a different language, we don’t have the same connections with the words.
: It makes it easier to maybe speak more honestly and not worry about what other people think of us.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 3) Who does he like showing off to?
4) How does she feel when she sings in front of people?
5) What does she think can make someone extroverted?

hive_text_custom.text: When you prefer your own company, you like being alone. When you keep someone company, you talk with them so they are not alone. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Can I keep you company?
 I enjoy the company of others.

hive_text_custom.text: Here, in reverse means the opposite order or way of something else. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Every morning, I eat, shower and check e-mail.
 
Me too, but in reverse. I check e-mail, shower and then eat.

hive_text_custom.text: When you show off, you try to display skills or things so other people notice them. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
My dad loves to show off his car.
 Bob is always showing off in class.

hive_text_custom.text: When you do something in public, you do it in front of strangers, people you do not know. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
I hate speaking in public.
 You should not wear that in public.

hive_text_custom.text: Here, to a certain extent means to some degree but not 100%. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He likes working there to a certain extent.
 She is the boss to a certain extent.

hive_text_custom.text: I think you can “fake it” quote-unquote.
We use the term "quote-unquote" to show that a term has special meaning or is a cliche. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
She is  a "tiger mom," quote-unquote.
 I try to quote-unquote "think outside the box."

hive_text_custom.text: He did what you said but just in
